\n Please follow these steps to get you:
Please follow these steps to get your Respond.io API token:
  
  1. Log in to your Respond.io account.
  2. In the left sidebar, navigate to Settings.
  3. Under Workspace Settings, click on Integrations.
  4. Locate and click on the Developer API option.
  5. Within the Developer API section, find your API key or generate a new one if needed.
Add an internal comment/note to a conver: Add an internal comment/note to a conversation in Respond.io.
Add one or multiple tags to a contact in: Add one or multiple tags to a contact in Respond.io.
Assign or unassign a conversation to/fro: Assign or unassign a conversation to/from a team member in Respond.io.
Create a new contact record in Respond.i: Create a new contact record in Respond.io.
Create a new contact or update an existi: Create a new contact or update an existing one by email, phone, or ID.
Permanently delete a contact from Respon: Permanently delete a contact from Respond.io.
Search for contacts by name, email, or p: Search for contacts by name, email, or phone number in Respond.io.
Mark a conversation as open in Respond.i: Mark a conversation as open in Respond.io.
Make a custom API call to a specific end: Make a custom API call to a specific endpoint
The internal comment to add (max 1000 ch: The internal comment to add (max 1000 characters). You can mention users with {{@user.ID}} format where ID is the user ID.
Tags to add to the contact (minimum 1, m: Tags to add to the contact (minimum 1, maximum 10 tags).
Select the user to assign the conversati: Select the user to assign the conversation to. Leave empty to unassign.
Must be a unique identifier for the new: Must be a unique identifier for the new contact. Use format: `email:user@example.com` or `phone:+60123456789`.
The email address of the contact.
The phone number of the contact (in E.16: The phone number of the contact (in E.164 format).
A direct URL to the contact's profile pi: A direct URL to the contact's profile picture.
Add custom fields for the contact.
Identifier for the contact. Use format:: Identifier for the contact. Use format: `id:123`, `email:user@example.com`, or `phone:+60123456789`. If contact exists, it will be updated; if not, a new one will be created.
The value to search for (e.g., email add: The value to search for (e.g., email address, phone number, or name).
Number of contacts to return (1-99). Def: Number of contacts to return (1-99). Default is 10.
Contact ID to start from for pagination. Optional.
Authorization headers are injected autom: Authorization headers are injected automatically from your connection.
Enable for files like PDFs, images, etc..
HEAD: HEAD
Triggers when a tag is added or removed: Triggers when a tag is added or removed from a contact in Respond.io.
Triggers when an existing contact is upd: Triggers when an existing contact is updated in Respond.io.
Triggers when a conversation is closed.
Triggers when a new conversation is open: Triggers when a new conversation is opened.
Triggers when a new contact is created i: Triggers when a new contact is created in Respond.io.
Triggers when a new message is received: Triggers when a new message is received from a contact.
Triggers when a message is sent from Res: Triggers when a message is sent from Respond.io.
\n\t\t\tTo use this trigger, you need to:
To use this trigger, you need to manually set up a webhook in your Respond.io account:

			1. Login to your Respond.io account.
			2. Go to Settings > Integrations > Webhooks.
			3. Click on "Add Webhook" or "Create New Webhook".
			4. Add the following URL in the **Webhook URL** field:
			```text
			{{webhookUrl}}
			```
			5. Select **contact.tag.updated** from the event types.
			6. Click Save to create the webhook.
